page.title: 05Landscape-Caerhay Castle
page.content: Caerhays Castle is a beautiful building of grey towers and turrets set in 60 acres of woods and park overlooking Porthluney Beach.There was a manor house here before the Norman invasion,but this castle was built in 1808.It was designed by John Nash,the architect of Buckingham Palace.It was built for the Trevanions but expense was so great they lost all their money and had to leave.The castle remained empty for years,the roof collapsed and caused much damage.It was bought by the Williams family in 1852 and is now occupied by Mr.Julian Williams.He is a council member who administers the Duchy of Cornwall for Prince Charles. The castle is not open to the public in June 1985 thirty children from Gorran School were invited there to look around and meet the owners.
